Module it.polimi.ingsw.GC24
Package view.screens

Class ConnectionScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.screens.Screen
      • view.screens.ConnectionScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObserver, TurnObserver, MessageTarget, Observer, View
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CLIConnectionScreen, GUIConnection
    public abstract class ConnectionScreen
extends Screen
    This screen asks to the user to insert an IP, a port, a nickname and the number of players. If inputs are valid, the active screen will be changed to GodSelectionScreen

        Sets the screen port address
        Parameters:

      • setNumberOfPlayers

        protected void setNumberOfPlayers​(int n)
        Sets the number of players preferred from the user
        Parameters:
        n - number of player, must be 2 or 3
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if number of players is not 2 or 3

      • setUsername

        protected final void setUsername​(java.lang.String username)
                          throws IllegalValueException
        Sets the screen username
        Parameters:
        username - The name, should be at least 3 and less than 30 chars long
        Throws:
        IllegalValueException - if the username is too short or too long

      • connect

        protected final void connect()
                      throws IllegalActionException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Tries to connect to the server with the ip and port. This function waits until the match is found. Loading screen should be shown before calling this function
        Throws:
        IllegalActionException - If all the necessary data (IP, PORT, USERNAME, N. PLAYERS) to connect to the sever was not filled from the user
        java.io.IOException - If the connection fails

        Parameters:
        playerName - The username assigned to this client from the server
